snippet: A survey by The New York Times, NY1 and Siena College shows a gap between the mayor’s expectations and his day-to-day ability to make social progress.
abstract: Poll conducted by The New York Times, NY1 and Siena College shows that nearly half of New Yorkers approve of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s job performance so far in City Hall; survey, however, underscores gap between soaring expectations he set coming into office and day-to-day ability of a municipal official to combat forces of social inequality, which mayor has declared as overarching aim of his administration.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and DALIA SUSSMAN
byline.contributor: Marina Stefan and Megan Thee-Brenan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A survey by The New York Times, NY1 and Siena College shows a gap between the mayor’s expectations and his day-to-day ability to make social progress.

headline.main: 49 Percent of New Yorkers Approve of de Blasio’s Performance, Poll Says
headline.print_headline: De Blasio’s Approval Rating at 49%, Poll Finds
